content.text:
# Recent Updates to ElizaOS

The ElizaOS repository has seen numerous updates across features, bug fixes, and maintenance tasks:

## New Features
- Added public access to packages (PR #2933)
- Integrated a new model provider for LM Studio (PR #2913)
- Improved Instagram client functionality (PR #2975)
- Enhanced arbitrage plugin with improved gas price optimization and volume calculation (PR #2869)
- Added more data when scraping tweets (PR #2644)
- Added Dependency Injection support for services and clients (PR #2855)
- Added missing plugins in package.json (PR #2947)
- Added Lit Protocol plugin with more actions (PR #2912)

## Bug Fixes
- Fixed numerous plugin issues including: arbitrage, omniflix, opacity, open-weather, openai, primus, quai, quick-intel, sei, sgx, spheron, squid-router, starknet, initia, injective, intiface, iq6900, irys, lensnetwork, letzai, lightning, lit, massa, mina, mind-network, moralis, movement, multiversx, near, news, nft-collection, nft-generation, obsidian, and router-nitro
- Fixed template typos (PR #2932)
- Fixed invalid npm package naming convention (PR #2930)
- Fixed missing version prop in package.json (PR #2929)
- Fixed OpenAI embedding issue (PR #3003)
- Fixed single quote handling bug in parseJsonArray (PR #2802)
- Fixed client server port (PR #2886)
- Fixed LOG_JSON_FORMAT environment variable setting (PR #2881)
- Changed default character from openai to llamalocal (PR #2880)
- Fixed tweet reply functionality to ensure replies to agent's initial tweet (PR #2966)
- Fixed whitespace handling in quote conversion (PR #2961)
- Fixed issue where {{maxTweetLength}} wasn't working in tweet post template (PR #2951)

## Testing and Documentation
- Added test coverage and configuration for multiple plugins including: asterai, avalanche, avail, autonome, arbitrage, and apro
- Fixed broken links to GitHub in documentation (PR #2987)
- Updated README_FR.md with complete translation (PR #2964)
- Fixed README's CONTRIBUTING.md link in plugin-multiversx package (PR #2985)

## Maintenance and Other Updates
- Updated pnpm to v9.15.0 for security (PR #2888)
- Updated dependency systeminformation to v5.23.8 for security (PR #2887)
- Fixed inconsistent folder naming convention (PR #2931)
- Made CI changes to allow package scoping to public (PR #2928)
- Updated LICENSE (PR #2903)
- Bumped version to 0.1.9 (PR #2883)
- Performed lockfile audit (PR #2994)
- Corrected typos in chat_2024-12-04.md (PR #2986)

categories.title: Discussions on AI Privacy, Open Source, and Technology

content.text: The benefits of offline AI like Ollama for privacy and freedom are highlighted, with users noting that people behave differently and self-censor when they know they're being watched online. Self-hosted and open source AI solutions are presented as ways to protect privacy while enabling use cases based on personal data.

There's support for open source AI, with one user encouraging Sam Altman to 'go back to being Open' and noting that 'it's good for everyone.' Another user points out that most coding tools and applications are built on open source foundations.
Discussion about hardware limitations for AI, with one user suggesting that Apple should make a device with significantly more VRAM.
Updates on the Eliza project, including a leaderboard for code contributors and mentions of an upcoming rebranding initiative as the project expands across multiple countries.
Various comments about DAOs, with mentions that AI16zdao was fair launched on daosdotfun and that party lists are a relatively new feature, with previous DAOs being 100% fair launches.

categories.title: Recent Issues in the Eliza GitHub Repository

content.text:
The Eliza GitHub repository is experiencing several issues across different areas of functionality. These issues can be categorized into several key areas:

1. **Installation and Build Problems**:
   - Issue #2885: The Eliza chatbot client is not running on localhost:5173
   - Issue #2963: The latest release version v0.1.8-alpha.1 is failing to build
   - Issue #2946: Docker build fails when using Gitlab CI with docker-in-docker setup
   - Issue #2871: Users are encountering errors after updating to the latest version

2. **Social Media Integration Issues**:
   - Issue #2891: There's a problem where a second tweet from an agent replies to the user instead of the initial agent tweet
   - Issue #2988: Error handling Twitter interactions with a SQLITE_ERROR code

3. **RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) and Knowledge Management**:
   - Issue #2918: Proposal to consolidate RAG Knowledge into Knowledge in V2
   - Issue #2914: The ragKnowledge feature is causing problems by retrieving entire documents, which bloats the prompt

4. **Feature Requests and Enhancements**:
   - Issue #2962: Request to implement an Action Set for NFT Creation & Management in the TON Plugin
   - Issue #2948: Request to add deepseek as a model provider for local running

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several new plugins and integrations have been proposed for the Eliza project:

- Lit Protocol plugin (PR #2912) by madschristensen99
- Orderly Network plugin (PR #2925) by Tarnadas
- Hash Network Plugin for Verifiable Inference (PR #2894) by Aman-14

These additions expand Eliza's functionality with new protocol and network integrations.

New social media clients are being implemented to expand Eliza's connectivity:

- LinkedIn client (PR #2972) by KacperKoza343
- Nostr client (PR #2982) by AbdelStark, which appears to be a resubmission of an earlier PR #1203

These additions will allow Eliza to interact with more social platforms.

Several code improvements are also in progress:

- A draft PR for model refactoring (PR #2910) by lalalune
- General Eliza updates (PR #2874) by magacek
- A fix to remove unnecessary TypeScript directives in the chat component (PR #2950) by wonseokjung

These changes aim to improve code quality and update existing functionality.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed consistent activity over a two-day period. From January 28-29, 2025, there were 50 new pull requests with 37 merged, 15 new issues created, and 44 active contributors. The following day (January 29-30, 2025) maintained similar levels of activity with 50 new pull requests (47 merged), 17 new issues, and 41 active contributors. The merge rate improved significantly on the second day, with 94% of PRs being merged compared to 74% on the first day.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
